pr_title: feat: Do not allow themeClass and themeName in same annotation

timeline.message:
feat: Do not allow themeClass and themeName in same annotation

Theme Class and Theme Name is not supported in
the same Theme annotation as theme name builds
on the Lumo theme.

test-themes is now for testing the Application theme only.
Old theme test was moved into test-misc.

Fixes #9370
Add validation that Lumo is available on the classpath.

timeline.bodyText: Refactor this code to not nest more than 3 if/for/while/switch/try statements.
timeline.author: vaadin-bot

timeline.bodyText: This block of code not changed, but I wonder why nothing is done when the themes is empty and the theme is null, that means the LUMO theme is not in classpath. Does that lead to same behaviour as if we had NoTheme set?
timeline.author: mshabarov

replies.bodyText:
If nothing is defined then everything should work the same as before so not having a theme definition and no lumo on classpath should result in no theme.
If theme name is defined we will throw that lumo needs to be on the classpath.
replies.author: caalador

timeline.bodyText: Am I right that the setting the themName will result to default theme (LUMO) styles + custom theme styles (they are merged in the end)?
timeline.author: mshabarov

replies.bodyText: The application theme always bases on lumo and lumo will be set for it.
